sentences.chinese: 東西周皆入于秦，周既不祀。
sentences.literal: Both east and west Zhou entered Qin. Zhou then ceased to sacrifice.
sentences.idiomatic: Both Eastern Zhou and Western Zhou fell to Qin. The Zhou sacrifices ceased.

sentences.chinese: 武王營之，成王使召公卜居，居九鼎焉，而周復都豐、鎬。
sentences.literal: King Wu planned it. King Cheng had the Duke of Shao divine the residence and placed the nine tripods there. But Zhou again made its capital Feng and Hao.
sentences.idiomatic: King Wu planned it. King Cheng had the Duke of Shao divine the site and placed the nine tripods there. But Zhou once again made its capital at Feng and Hao.

sentences.chinese: 至犬戎敗幽王，周乃東徙于洛邑。
sentences.literal: Until the Quanrong defeated King You, Zhou then moved east to Luoyi.
sentences.idiomatic: Until the Quanrong defeated King You, the Zhou then moved their capital east to Luoyi.

sentences.chinese: 漢興九十有餘載，天子將封泰山，東巡狩至河南，求周苗裔，封其後嘉三十里地，號曰周子南君，比列侯，以奉其先祭祀。
sentences.literal: The Han rose for ninety remaining years. The Son of Heaven would seal Mount Tai, and on his eastern inspection reached Henan. He sought Zhou descendants and enfeoffed their descendant Jia with thirty li of land, titling him Zhou Zi Nan Jun, equal to marquises, to serve their ancestors' sacrifices.
sentences.idiomatic: Ninety years after the Han rose, the emperor prepared to seal Mount Tai. On his eastern inspection tour he reached Henan and sought Zhou descendants. He enfeoffed their descendant Jia with thirty li of land, titled him Lord Zhou Zi Nan, equal in rank to marquises, to maintain their ancestral sacrifices.
